etymology.description: Pictogram: ribs/section of meat; stylized as 月 when beside a phonetic, and as 𱼀 or 夕 inside some characters.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts the cross-section of flesh with ribs or a slice of meat. In compounds it often appears as a component written like 月, or reduced to 𱼀/夕, which can be mistaken for the moon component but actually signals ‘meat/flesh.’

examples.chinese: 我不吃猪肉(我不吃豬肉)。
这道菜肉很多，很鲜嫩(這道菜肉很多，很鮮嫩)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào cài ròu hěn duō, hěn xiānnèn.
examples.english: This dish has a lot of meat; it's very tender.

examples.chinese: 受伤后，他手上的肉裂开了(受傷後，他手上的肉裂開了)。
examples.pinyin: Shòushāng hòu, tā shǒushang de ròu liè kāi le.
examples.english: After being injured, the flesh on his hand split open.
